items.title: My wife and I passed on a family wedding due to a ‘no-child’ rule. We’re now attending a friend’s nuptials without our kids. Are we hypocrites?
items.description: “My in-laws are coming to watch our 7-year-old daughter and her 2-year-old sister.”

items.title: U.K. Pound, Bonds Slide; U.S. Stock Market Closed
items.description: Volatility in U.K. asset prices evokes memories of the 2022 market meltdown.

items.title: Medicare can cover Zepbound for sleep apnea, creating a significant opportunity for Eli Lilly
items.description: Zepbound is not covered by Medicare or many other insurance plans as a treatment for weight loss. The injectable treatment costs about $1,000 a month ...

items.title: ‘We’ve had two cars for 40 years’: With congestion charges, insurance and gas prices — should we sell our second car? Or will we regret it?
items.description: “I’m semi-retired working about 20 hours a month at my own business.”

items.title: Micron’s stock leads the S&P 500 for 2025. Here’s why more gains could follow.
items.description: An analyst sees big upside ahead, fueled by rapid growth in high-bandwidth memory for AI.
